txt.en: 'I believe that my unwillingness to spare kindness for strangers may keep the people of my city alive....'
'...but our good guest has shown me that some folk are worth trusting.'
'With the compliments of the Rohirrim of Harwick, I extend an apology and welcome to [placeholder].'
'I would like you to hear the things that are being said about you.'
Harwick
'I would like to speak my piece, Reeve Harding.'
'The survivors of Langhold are housed in tents outside the city walls.'
'My dear CÃ­llan, you may speak at any time! Please, go on.'
'I had the honour of meeting [placeholder] in Langhold, at my husband's table.'
'I would take them in, but short of having them stay in the Mead Hall, there is no room for them.'
'Are you here to spy on me? Are you a servant of Wormtongue?'
'How are our defences holding?'
'Or perhaps an agent of the Easterlings!'
'I beg your pardon, but someone is here.'
'You may have come to seek my favour, but you will not have it, yet. I do not trust you.'
'Indeed. What is the meaning of this intrusion?'
'They were nearly destroyed by Easterlings, and some folks were taken prisoner.'
'I would like to begin by apologizing.'
'I received our guest with unjust suspicion at first.'
'A perfect guest, and a brave warrior. If not for [placeholder], every one of us would be dead.'
'The Stable Guard also reported some incidents, but nothing we cannot handle.'
'Hear, hear!'
'Get out of my city, now. You have not wronged me yet, so I will not imprison you.'
'To [placeholder]!'
'But you are a trespasser, and are therefore under my command.'
'My most trusted sergeants have similar tales of your heroics, [placeholder].'
'Agelmund, take this [placeholder] out of here. Do as you will.'
'For your services to Langhold and Harwick, I name you Knight of the Wold!'
'My only wish is that my husband had heeded [placeholder]'s warnings sooner about --'
'Please, [placeholder], forgive my past  behaviour, and consider Harwick your home.'
'...Never mind that. What is done is done.'
'This meeting is now adjourned.'
'All I ask, [placeholder], is that you bear no regret for your role in the fall of Utred, and Langhold.'
Guard
'I will always be in your debt for your noble efforts. I and my children.'
'With pleasure, Aldor Harding. Come, trespasser. You report to me now, unless you wish to see the stocks.'
'Well said!'
